sources.title: The Apache Kid's Escape
sources.description: A hilariously inept poverty row western starring Jack Perrin. The plot and dialog are worse than comic-book juvenile. The acting wouldn't pass muster for the cast of a middle school play. The fistfights are more like friendly wrestling matches. This one is a real laugher, but to be fair some of the continunity gaffs might be the result of the botched TV edit. Written and directed by Robert J Horner. Released in 1930. Complete print (1949 TV edit)

sources.title: The Apache Kid's Escape (1930) JACK PERRIN
sources.description:
Stars: Jack Perrin, Fred Church, Josephine Hill
 Director: Robert J. Horner

 Staying one step ahead of the law, the Apache Kid helps out a cowboy in trouble.

metadata.Plot: After escaping from Sheriff Lang, the Apache Kid takes a job on the Wilson ranch as Jim. Wilson's hand Ted Conway uses the kerchief given him by Jim and robs the stage. But his Apache Kid impersonation fails and he is jailed. Jim's job now is to set Ted straight, return the gold, and put the Apache Kid name to rest.
metadata.Actors: Jack Perrin, Fred Church, Josephine Hill
